metadata.feature_description: Configures multi-threaded crawling for improved performance.

steps.expected: Scheduler panel loads with list of scheduled tasks
steps.actual: Scheduler panel loaded successfully showing all scheduled tasks including Search: Url Crawler, Search: File Crawler, and Search: Site Crawler

steps.action: Click SCHEDULER tab to view scheduled tasks list
steps.expected: List of scheduled tasks with configuration options
steps.actual: Scheduler tab shows list of tasks with Task Name, Frequency, Retry Time Lapse, Next Start, and Enabled columns. Global scheduler shows Max Threads: 1

steps.action: Click Edit Task for Search: Url Crawler to find thread configuration
steps.expected: Thread count configuration setting should be visible
steps.actual: Edit Task panel shows settings for Friendly Name, Full Class Name, Retain Schedule History, Servers, Object Dependencies, Schedule Start Date/Time, Frequency, Retry Time Lapse, Run on Event, Catch Up Tasks, Enable Schedule. No thread count/IndexThreads setting is visible.

steps.action: Scroll to bottom of task settings panel
steps.actual: Bottom of settings panel shows all available options but no thread count setting is present

steps.action: Navigate to Site Settings > Search > Crawling tab
steps.expected: Thread configuration setting should be available in Search Crawling settings
steps.actual: Crawling tab shows Url Paths, Duplicates regex patterns, Included Directories, and Excluded Directories. No thread count configuration is available.

steps.action: Scroll to view all Crawling settings
steps.actual: Full Crawling settings page shows only URL Paths (with Enable Spidering, DNN Impersonation, Windows Auth options), Duplicates patterns, Included Directories, and Excluded Directories. No thread count/IndexThreads setting is exposed in the UI.

issues: The IndexThreads setting exists in code (Spider.cs line 342, SearchSpiderHelper.cs line 588) but is NOT exposed in any UI
Thread count is stored in database ScheduleItemSettings table with default value of 1, but cannot be configured through the admin interface
Feature described as 'Configure thread count' cannot be tested as there is no UI element to perform this action

observations: Code analysis confirms IndexThreads setting exists in Spider.Start() method (Spider.cs:342) which accepts a 'threads' parameter
SearchSpiderHelper.cs (line 588) reads IndexThreads from scheduleHistoryItemSettings with default value of 1: IndexThreads = GetSettingValue(scheduleHistoryItemSettings, 'IndexThreads', 1)
The thread count setting is stored in the ScheduleItemSettings database table (01.00.01.SqlDataProvider line 223 shows default insert with value '1')
Global scheduler Max Threads is visible (currently set to 1) but this controls overall scheduler thread pool, not the SearchCrawler-specific thread count
Multi-threading configuration for SearchCrawler is a backend/database-only setting with no UI exposure - would require direct database manipulation or custom code to change
UI Location specified as 'Admin > Schedule > SearchCrawler Settings' does not exist as a separate menu item - SearchCrawler settings are integrated into Site Settings > Search > Crawling
